reviews.title: A must do
text: We had pre-booked a tour to Niagara with grey line tours. Our guide for the day was very knowledgeable and made the day. We had lunch in the Sheraton then did the horn-blower tour before moving on to spend some time at Niagara-on-the-Lake. What a beautiful place to visit.

reviews.title: Amazing tour
text: Fantastic tour excellent tour guide mesmerising seeing the falls a wonderful day out for all the family the fireworks in the evening were wonderful

reviews.title: Niagara full day tour with  Kings
text: Excellent  day out. Salim  the driver  was excellent from start to finish.  Adjusting  the itinerary so that we made best use of our  3 hours at the falls. Pick up from Scarborough by Uber all part of the service.

reviews.title: Amazing experience of Niagara Falls
text: We had pre-booked our Niagara Falls private car tour (for Mon 18th February) prior to visiting Toronto from the UK. Booking process was simple and confirmation was quick.
Although an SUV had been confirmed as our transport, what actually turned up to take us on our tour was a stretch limo. This made our day trip even more special.
Our driver (Naveed) was extremely accommodating and knowledgable providing â€˜tour guideâ€™ commentary and information throughout.

Included in our Niagara trip was a winery visit and stop-off at Niagara on the Lake. The wine tasting was fabulous as was our host at the winery who was informative on the winemaking/tasting and happy to answer all our questions. Niagara on the Lake is beautiful and we could have spent more time there than was available during our tour.
We had booked â€˜behind the fallsâ€™ as part of the tour but had forgotten to bring the ticket printout with us on the trip. This wasnâ€™t a problem, Naveed said heâ€™d sort it out and he did.
Many thanks again Naveed for a fabulous day trip. Our Niagara Falls limo trip is one we will remember.

reviews.title: Day tour of Niagara Falls
text: We booked this tour through trip advisor and had an awesome experience. Our driver was Ralph and he was super cool.  We left on time at 8:10am and got to Niagara Falls around 10:30am and it was a very smooth ride.  I actually fell asleep on the bus ride there. :)  We chose not to do the cruise and didnâ€™t really need too because you can walk alongside and see the beautiful falls.  The falls on the Canada side are better than the US side. There are places to eat and shop if you want and to have about 3 hours to explore.  We also went to a winery, stop by the smallest chapel , neighborhood store anc the cutest town. It was a wonderful experience and so glad we did it. We got back to Toronto around 6:20pm and overall it was a great day and thanks Ralph for being an awesome driver and for giving us a cool history lesson.

reviews.title: Great day
text: Our driver, Roy, was great. He altered our agenda to fit the weather which was very misty when we got to Niagara. At his suggestion we did the walk behind Niagara first and by the time we came out it had cleared and we had a terrific trip on the Hornblower cruise. He was informative along the way and very attentive to our needs. Would recommend to anyone going to Niagara from Toronto.

reviews.title: I want to go back in winter!
text: Second time and same love for this place! It's unbelievable!
Highly recommend to take boat tour to 'feel' the falls:)

reviews.title: Great day out!
text: Niagara Airbus run a great day trip to Niagara Falls from Toronto down town.  The drivers are very knowledgeable and attentive. The trip is featured by the falls.  We went in winter, therefore were offered the behind the falls option.  Not bad!  The falls themselves are spectacular.  A real bucket list day!

reviews.title: Great Choice!
text: Driver David was fantastic.  I was picked up promptly at arranged pickup time from my hotel and we had a pleasant journey with David telling us interesting facts along the way.
Stopped at Niagara on the lake with Vineyard stop after which was enjoyable.
I did not feel the clock was worth stopping for as it shortened the time in Niagara falls.
Don't skip the boat ride, as it was very exciting.
A smaller group on this tour was the way to go.  Remember if you are on a large tour, they have to round up way more people every time you stop and there are always people late.

reviews.title: Fun trip
text: Fun day learning about the falls, be ready to get wet. A fast trip on the water to visit the falls but if is wurth the trip.

reviews.title: Good trip
text: Pick up was prompt, and bus driver was very friendly. All of the activities listed on the website happened and we had a couple of hours at the Falls, which was more than enough. I guess the "guided tour" part of the trip didn't live up to my expectations as i hadn't appreciated that our driver was the tour guide and that all of our observations would be from the bus.

Admittedly this is not the best season to visit the Falls as the hornblower cruise runs only from April, some of the observation points in the Journey Behind the Falls were frozen, and many of the shops on Niagara-on-the-lake were closed.
Overall it was a good trip but I wonder how much money I would have saved if I'd just taken public transport to the Falls, as I have a feeling that the experience wouldn't have been hugely different.

reviews.title: A Great Way to visit Niagara Falls in a day from Toronto, Ontario Canada
text: I thought it was time to see Niagara Falls again, since I am sure some of the main areas must have changed in the over forty since since my last visit.

I found Niagara Tours through the internet and since the daily rate was very reasonable (and they also picked me up and dropped me off from downtown Toronto) at no extra charge, I just couldn't not take the trip to the falls.
The company was very prompt with the pickup and the vehicle that arrived was very new, clean and tidy.  The owner was actually doing the driving and was very pleasant and professionally dressed.
When we arrived at their office, we paid for the tour and any extras that were selected and then used their bathrooms before the bus arrived.
The bus was nicely air conditioned and seemed to be in good working order.
The driver was again, professionally dressed and had a pleasant demeanor.
We could select our own seats and wasn't long before we departed their office on our way to the first stop which was a winery for a complimentary tasting.
We then went to an airport for those people on the bus that wanted to take a helicopter ride over the falls and then we headed to Niagara.

We were given approximately 3 1/2 hours to walk around at our leisure sight seeing and taking pictures. We grabbed a quick lunch at the casino and even had a little time to try the one armed bandits.  (I did come out on top with a win when I left).

It was time to get back on the bus and then we were taken around the falls with stops at the whirlpool view spot, and Niagara on the Lake.  We even stopped at the clock of flowers for more photo opportunities and then we got back on the bus for our ride back to Toronto.

I would definitely recommend this tour for anyone wanting to sit back, relax and leave the driving to someone else.  It was a great way to see all that the Niagara region has to offer in a day for a reasonable rate.  This tour is good for all ages and even those with walking issues as everything is at a good proximity to all attractions or the bus.
